metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 12 axioms covering scales as composite entities with partial orderings, scale operations, and qualitative structure
metadata.notation: First-order logic with scales, partial orderings, and qualitative regions

axioms.title: Definition of scale
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (if (scale s) (and (compositeEntity s) (exists (s1 e x y s2 s3) (and (componentsOf s1 s) (partialOrdering e x y s) (subset s2 s3)(relationsOf s3 s) (forall (e1) (if (member e1 s2) (exists (x1 y1) (and (member x1 s1)(member y1 s1) (subst2 x1 y1 e1 x y e)))))))))))
axioms.english: A scale is a composite entity with components and a partial ordering relation among them

axioms.title: Partial ordering constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y s) (if (partialOrdering e x y s) (and (scale s)(arg* x e)(arg* y e))))
axioms.english: If e is a partial ordering on scale s, then s is a scale and e is a relation between x and y

axioms.title: Definition of inScale
axioms.fol: (forall (y s) (iff (inScale y s) (and (scale s)(componentOf y s))))
axioms.english: Being in a scale is an abbreviation for being a component of a scale

axioms.title: Definition of lts (less than scale)
axioms.fol: (forall (e x1 y1 s) (iff (lts' e1 x1 y1 s) (exists (e x y e1) (and (partialOrdering e x y s) (subst2 x y e x1 y1 e1)))))
axioms.english: lts defines a 'less than' relation relative to a particular scale s using substitution into the partial ordering

axioms.title: Partial ordering is antireflexive
axioms.fol: (forall (x s) (not (lts x x s)))
axioms.english: The partial ordering is antireflexive - no element is less than itself

axioms.title: Partial ordering is antisymmetric
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s) (if (lts x y s)(not (lts y x s))))
axioms.english: The partial ordering is antisymmetric - if x < y then not y < x

axioms.title: Partial ordering is transitive
axioms.fol: (forall (x y z s) (if (and (lts x y s)(lts y z s)) (lts x z s)))
axioms.english: The partial ordering is transitive - if x < y and y < z then x < z

axioms.title: Definition of gts (greater than scale)
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s) (iff (gts y x s)(lts x y s)))
axioms.english: Greater than is defined as the reverse of less than

axioms.title: lts argument constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s) (if (lts x y s) (and (or (inScale x s) (exists (x1) (and (at x x1 s)(inScale x1 s)))) (or (inScale y s) (exists (y1) (and (at y y1 s)(inScale y1 s)))))))
axioms.english: Arguments of lts must be either points on the scale or entities at points on the scale

axioms.title: at relation preserves ordering
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 y1 y2 s) (and (if (at x1 y1 s) (iff (lts x1 y2 s)(lts y1 y2 s))) (if (at x2 y2 s) (iff (lts y1 x2 s)(lts y1 y2 s))) (if (and (at x1 y1 s)(at x2 y2 s)) (iff (lts x1 x2 s)(lts y1 y2 s)))))
axioms.english: The at relation preserves the partial ordering - entities at points inherit the ordering of those points

axioms.title: Definition of onScale
axioms.fol: (forall (x s) (iff (onScale x s) (or (inScale x s) (exists (y) (and (inScale y s)(at x y s))))))
axioms.english: onScale covers both points in a scale and entities at points in a scale

axioms.title: Definition of leqs (less than or equal scale)
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s) (iff (leqs x y s) (or (lts x y s) (and (onScale x s)(equal x y)))))
axioms.english: Less than or equal is either less than or equal (for entities on the scale)

axioms.title: Definition of geqs (greater than or equal scale)
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s) (iff (geqs x y s) (or (gts x y s) (and (onScale x s)(equal x y)))))
axioms.english: Greater than or equal is either greater than or equal (for entities on the scale)

axioms.title: Antisymmetric property for leqs
axioms.fol: (forall (x y s) (if (and (leqs x y s)(leqs y x s)) (equal x y)))
axioms.english: If x ≤ y and y ≤ x, then x = y (antisymmetry for ≤)

axioms.title: Definition of top of scale
axioms.fol: (forall (x s) (iff (top x s) (and (inScale x s) (forall (y) (if (inScale y s)(leqs y x s))))))
axioms.english: The top of a scale is the highest point - all other points are less than or equal to it

axioms.title: Definition of bottom of scale
axioms.fol: (forall (x s) (iff (bottom x s) (and (inScale x s) (forall (y) (if (inScale y s)(leqs x y s))))))
axioms.english: The bottom of a scale is the lowest point - it is less than or equal to all other points

axioms.title: Definition of subscale
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s) (iff (subscale s1 s) (and (scale s1)(scale s) (forall (x) (if (inScale x s1)(inScale x s))) (forall (x y) (iff (lts x y s1) (and (inScale x s1)(inScale y s1) (lts x y s)))))))
axioms.english: A subscale has a subset of components and the partial ordering restricted to that subset

axioms.title: Definition of reverse scale
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s) (iff (reverse s1 s) (and (scale s1)(scale s) (forall (x y) (and (iff (inScale x s)(inScale x s1)) (iff (lts x y s)(lts y x s1)))))))
axioms.english: The reverse of a scale has the same components but reversed partial ordering

axioms.title: Disjoint scales
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s2) (if (and (scale s1)(scale s2)) (iff (disjoint s1 s2) (exists (s3 s4) (and (componentsOf s3 s1)(componentsOf s4 s2) (disjoint s3 s4))))))
axioms.english: Two scales are disjoint if their sets of components are disjoint

axioms.title: Definition of total ordering
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y s) (if (lts' e x y s) (iff (totalOrdering e x y s) (forall (x1 y1) (if (and (inScale x1 s)(inScale y1 s)) (or (lts x1 y1 s)(equal x1 y1) (lts y1 x1 s)))))))
axioms.english: A total ordering is a partial ordering where any two elements are comparable

axioms.title: Scales are grounds
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (if (scale s)(ground s)))
axioms.english: A scale is potentially a ground - entities can be located 'at' points on a scale

axioms.title: Extended function definition for scales
axioms.fol: (forall (f s1 s2) (iff (function f s1 s2) (exists (s3 s4) (and (if (set s1)(equal s3 s1)) (if (scale s1)(componentsOf s3 s1)) (if (set s2)(equal s4 s2)) (if (scale s2)(componentsOf s4 s2)) (function0 f s3 s4)))))
axioms.english: Extends the notion of function to scales by using their component sets as domain/range

axioms.title: Definition of monotone increasing function
axioms.fol: (forall (f s1 s2) (if (and (function f s1 s2)(scale s1)(scale s2)) (iff (monotoneIncreasing f) (forall (x1 x2 y1 y2) (if (and (map f x1 y1)(map f x2 y2)(lts x1 x2 s1)) (lts y1 y2 s2))))))
axioms.english: A scale-to-scale function is monotone-increasing if it preserves the 'less than' ordering

axioms.title: Definition of function into
axioms.fol: (forall (f s1 s3) (iff (functionInto f s1 s3) (exists (s2) (and (or (subset s2 s3)(subscale s2 s3)) (function f s1 s2)))))
axioms.english: A function f is 'into' a set or scale s3 if there is a subset or subscale s2 for which f is onto

axioms.title: Definition of scaleDefinedBy
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 e) (iff (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e) (and (scale s)(componentsOf s1 s) (exists (x y) (partialOrdering e x y s)))))
axioms.english: A scale is defined by specifying the set of entities as components and the relation as partial ordering

axioms.title: Sequence as scale
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 e x y) (if (and (sequence s)(componentsOf s1 s) (beforeInSeq' e x y s)) (and (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e) (forall (z)(if (first z s)(bottom z s))))))
axioms.english: A sequence is a scale whose partial ordering is the beforeInSeq relation, with first element as bottom

axioms.title: Set of sets as scale
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 e x y) (if (and (forall (s2)(if (member s2 s1)(set s2))) (subset' e x y)) (exists (s) (and (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e) (forall (z) (if (and (member z s1)(null z)) (bottom z s)))))))
axioms.english: A set of sets under the subset relation is a scale, with null set as bottom if present

axioms.title: Definition of subset consistent scale
axioms.fol: (forall (s e) (iff (subsetConsistent s e) (and (scale s)(eventuality e) (forall (s0)(if (argn s0 1 e)(set s0))) (forall (x)(if (argn x 2 e)(exists (y)(at x y s)))) (forall (e1 e2 s1 s2 x1 x2) (if (and (instance e1 e)(argn s1 1 e1) (argn x1 2 e1) (instance e2 e)(argn s2 1 e2) (argn x2 2 e2) (subset s1 s2)) (leqs x1 x2 s))))))
axioms.english: A scale whose ordering is consistent with the subset ordering among sets associated with entities placed at points in the scale

axioms.title: Monotonicity condition for subset mapping
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s2 x1 x2 s) (if (and (subset s1 s2)(r s1 x1)(r s2 x2)) (leqs x1 x2 s)))
axioms.english: Given some mapping r, if s1 ⊆ s2 and r maps s1 to x1 and s2 to x2, then x1 ≤ x2 on the scale

axioms.title: Definition of composite scale
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 s2) (if (compositeScale s s1 s2) (and (exists (s3) (and (componentsOf s3 s1)(componentsOf s3 s2) (componentsOf s3 s))) (forall (x y) (if (and (lts x y s1)(leqs x y s2)) (lts x y s))) (forall (x y) (if (and (leqs x y s1)(lts x y s2)) (lts x y s))))))
axioms.english: A composite scale has the same components as two original scales and ordering consistent with both

axioms.title: Hi region is subscale
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s) (if (Hi s1 s)(subscale s1 s)))
axioms.english: The Hi region of a scale is a subscale

axioms.title: Md region is subscale
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s) (if (Md s1 s)(subscale s1 s)))
axioms.english: The Md (middle) region of a scale is a subscale

axioms.title: Lo region is subscale
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s) (if (Lo s1 s)(subscale s1 s)))
axioms.english: The Lo (low) region of a scale is a subscale

axioms.title: Top of scale is top of Hi region
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s) (if (Hi s1 s) (forall (x) (iff (top x s)(top x s1)))))
axioms.english: The top of the scale is in the Hi region and is the top of the Hi region

axioms.title: Bottom of scale is bottom of Lo region
axioms.fol: (forall (s1 s) (if (Lo s1 s) (forall (x) (iff (bottom x s)(bottom x s1)))))
axioms.english: The bottom of a scale is the bottom of its Lo region

axioms.title: Lo region is less than Hi region
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 s2 x y) (if (and (Hi s1 s)(Lo s2 s)(inScale x s1)(inScale y s2)) (lts y x s)))
axioms.english: If a point is in the Lo region, then it is less than all the points in the Hi region

axioms.title: Definition of scaleFor
axioms.fol: (forall (s e) (iff (scaleFor s e) (exists (s1) (and (Hi s1 s) (forall (e1 x y) (if (and (at' e1 x y s1)(argn x 1 e)) (iff (Rexist e)(Rexist e1))))))))
axioms.english: An entity x has property e exactly when x is at a point in the Hi region of scale s - connects absolute adjectives to their underlying scales

axioms.title: Hi region properties are goal-relevant
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y s1 s) (if (and (at' e x y s1)(Hi s1 s)(etc)) (exists (c a g g1) (and (member e c)(goal g a) (or (causalComplex c g) (and (not' g1 g)(causalComplex c g1)))))))
axioms.english: If something is in the Hi region of a scale, then defeasibly that property plays a causal role in some agent's goal being achieved or not achieved

conversion_notes.scales_as_composite_entities: Scales are composite entities with components and partial ordering relations
conversion_notes.qualitative_regions: Hi, Md, Lo regions provide qualitative structure for reasoning about scales
conversion_notes.scale_to_scale_functions: Extended function theory to work with scales as domains and ranges
conversion_notes.ground_connection: Scales serve as grounds for the figure-ground at relation
conversion_notes.linguistic_connection: scaleFor connects absolute adjectives (tall) to their underlying scales (height)
conversion_notes.functionality_connection: Axiom 12.38 connects scalar properties to goal-oriented functionality
conversion_notes.multiple_examples: Shows how sequences and sets of sets can be viewed as scales

file_format_notes.completeness: All axioms from Chapter 12 extracted and converted
file_format_notes.validation: All FOL expressions validated for syntactic correctness
file_format_notes.foundation: Provides mathematical foundation for qualitative reasoning and natural language semantics
